metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14997 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (excessive memory allocation) because of an integer underflow in ReadPICTImage in coders/pict.c. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14997` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-13
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-13
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-13
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-13
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-13').
